abstract: Wells Fargo, despite the pressure from unions, should resi
snippet: Wells Fargo, despite the pressure from unions, should resi
lead_paragraph: The most depressing story I’ve read in awhile was one in Tuesday’s New York Times, entitled “Workers Pressure Banks To Keep Clothier’s U.S. Plants Open.” The bank in question is Wells Fargo, which of course was the unhappy recipient of government bailout funds, to the tune of $25 billion — money it claims it never needed and now cannot give back. The clothier in question is Hartmarx, which makes Hart Schaffner & Mark as well as Hickey Freeman suits.
